data.title: 20 Top-rated Movies Like Whiplash You’ll Regret Not Watching
data.meta_description: From "The Prestige" to "Joker", "A Beautiful Mind", etc., here are 20 top-rated handpicked movies like "Whiplash" you don't want to miss.
data.text:
Welcome! Today, I’ll show you 20 top-rated movies that are like Whiplash.

For those who are familiar with the film, Whiplash is a story of talent, resilience, and the lengths people can go to bring out the best in others.

I would have loved to give a brief summary of the movie, but that isn’t what we came here for, so, let’s get down to business.

Walk with me!

20 Top-Rated Movies Like Whiplash

Joker

Joker tells the story of Arthur Fleck, a struggling comedian in Gotham City, set in the 1980s. Arthur lives with his mother and suffers from mental health issues, which cause him to uncontrollably laugh at inappropriate times. He works as a clown for hire but faces constant bullying and isolation from society, making his life increasingly difficult and lonely.

Arthur’s dream is to become a successful stand-up comedian, but he faces constant rejection and humiliation. His life takes a darker turn when he discovers some unsettling truths about his past and his mother, leading him to question his place in the world. As he struggles to cope with his emotions and circumstances, he begins to descend into madness.

Amidst the social and economic turmoil in Gotham City, Arthur’s transformation into the Joker begins to take shape. He adopts a new persona, embracing chaos and violence, which starts to inspire others in the city. The film explores Arthur’s journey from a marginalized and troubled individual to becoming the infamous Joker, a symbol of anarchy and rebellion against a society that has failed him.

Black Swan

“Black Swan” follows Nina Sayers, a dedicated ballerina in New York City, who dreams of landing the lead role in her company’s production of “Swan Lake.” Nina is a perfectionist and works tirelessly to achieve her goal. Her efforts pay off when the artistic director, Thomas, casts her as both the innocent White Swan and the seductive Black Swan. While Nina is perfect for the White Swan, she struggles to embody the darker, more sensual role of the Black Swan.

As Nina tries to master the dual role, she faces intense pressure and competition from a new dancer, Lily. Unlike Nina, Lily embodies the wild and free-spirited nature of the Black Swan effortlessly. Nina becomes increasingly paranoid, fearing that Lily is trying to take her role. This rivalry, coupled with the demands of the role, starts to affect Nina’s mental state, blurring the lines between reality and hallucination.

Nina’s obsession with perfection and fear of losing her role lead her down a dark path. She begins to experience strange and disturbing visions, causing her to question her own sanity. As the opening night of “Swan Lake” approaches, Nina’s grip on reality continues to slip, creating a tense and haunting atmosphere as she pushes herself to her limits to achieve a flawless performance.

The King’s Speech

The King’s Speech is a historical drama that follows the life of Prince Albert, known to his family as Bertie, who later becomes King George VI of the United Kingdom. Bertie has a severe stutter problem, which makes public speaking a nightmare for him. After trying numerous treatments without success, he seeks the help of an unconventional speech therapist named Lionel Logue.

Lionel uses unique and sometimes strange methods to help Bertie. Their relationship starts off rocky because of Lionel’s informal approach and insistence on treating Bertie as an equal rather than a royal. However, as they continue to work together, Bertie begins to make progress, and a deep friendship develops between them.

As political tensions rise in Europe and his brother abdicates the throne, Bertie is suddenly thrust into the spotlight as king. He must deliver a crucial speech to inspire and unite the nation. Despite the pressure and his speech impediment, Bertie prepares for this monumental task with Lionel’s guidance, showcasing his determination and courage.

Sound of Metal

Sound of Metal is a powerful drama that follows Ruben, a heavy metal drummer, whose life is turned upside down when he begins to lose his hearing. His world, built around sound and rhythm, starts to crumble as he faces the terrifying prospect of silence.

With the support of his girlfriend, Lou, Ruben enters a sober living facility for the deaf, where he’s introduced to a completely different way of life. As he grapples with his newfound reality, he must find a way to reconcile his identity as a musician with his changing world.

tick, tick… BOOM!

Tick, Tick…Boom! is a semi-autobiographical musical drama following Jon, an aspiring composer struggling to make it in New York City’s theater scene.

As his 30th birthday looms, Jon feels the pressure to create something groundbreaking while balancing his career aspirations with his personal life.

The film delves into the challenges faced by artists chasing their dreams, including financial struggles, relationship tensions, and the fear of running out of time.

With a ticking clock and mounting pressure, Jon grapples with the question of whether he’s made the right choices and if his dreams are worth the sacrifices he’s making.
